pButton.Name: A
pButton.popInfo:
Sample Question: Identify three important political philosophers of the Enlightenment.
Sample Answer: John Locke, Voltaire, and Jean-Jacques Rousseau.

pButton.Name: B
pButton.popInfo:
Sample Question: Describe John Locke’s political philosophy.
Sample Answer: John Locke believed that each person was born with natural rights. These rights include life, liberty and property. Locke also believed that people had a right to overthrow their government if it did not protect the natural rights of the people.

pButton.Name: C
pButton.popInfo:
Sample Question: Explain how John Locke’s political philosophy influenced politics in the eighteenth century.
Sample Answer: John Locke’s philosophy of natural rights and his belief in the right to rebellion were significant because they influenced the leaders of the American Revolution in the 1770s and the leaders of the French Revolution in 1789.
